context_of_use: This use case allows an admin to manage product-related tasks within the system.
stakeholders_and_interests: admin: Control product availability and pricing
description: Enables admins to create products, update product prices, and manage inventory levels.
preconditions: Admin is logged into the system.
Admin has the necessary permissions to manage products.
postconditions: Products are created or updated successfully.
assumptions: The admin has access to the product management interface.
The system has the capability to create, update, and manage products.
requirements_met: The system shall allow admins to create new products.
The system shall allow admins to update product prices.
The system shall allow admins to manage inventory levels.
outstanding_issues: Clarification needed on the process for handling out-of-stock products.
main_flow: 1. Admin selects the option to create a product → System prompts for product details.
2. Admin enters product details and submits → System creates the product and confirms creation.
3. Admin selects the option to update product prices → System prompts for product selection and new price.
4. Admin selects a product and enters a new price → System updates the product price and confirms update.
5. Admin selects the option to manage inventory → System displays current inventory levels.
6. Admin adjusts inventory levels as needed → System updates inventory and confirms changes.
